alert.note: Alert for Craighead; Cross; Poinsett (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 5:57AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL CRAIGHEAD... POINSETT AND NORTH CENTRAL CROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 630 AM CST... At 556 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Waldenburg, or 8 miles southwest of Harrisburg, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Jonesboro, Trumann, Marked Tree, Harrisburg, Bay, Weiner, Waldenburg, Greenfield, Fisher, Payneway, Hergett, Wiley Crossing, Apt, Tulot, Supply, Weona Junction, Weona, Hatchie Coon, Gum Point, and Stewart. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for eastern Arkansas.
